wesm commented on pull request #6766: ARROW-8274: [C++] Use LZ4 frame format for "LZ4" compression in IPC
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6766#discussion_r400585023
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/util/compression.cc
 ##########
 @@ -155,6 +159,16 @@ Result<std::unique_ptr<Codec>> Codec::Create(Compression::type codec_type,
       break;
 #else
       return Status::NotImplemented("LZ4 codec support not built");
+#endif
+    case Compression::LZ4_FRAME:
+#ifdef ARROW_WITH_LZ4
+      if (compression_level_set) {
+        return Status::Invalid("LZ4 doesn't support setting a compression level.");
 
 Review comment:
   Note: it seems that the LZ4 frame format does support setting compression levels (which internally switches between lz4.h and lz4hc.h). Fine to leave this as is but we might return in the future and enable setting the lz4hc compression levels (values above 0).
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description: Currently the non-frame format is being used.
fields.summary: [C++] Use LZ4 frame format for "LZ4" compression in IPC write

comments.body: I think we should actually expose LZ4 and framed LZ4 as two separate codecs (we cannot easily pass codec-specific options).
Another possibility is to use streaming compression and decompression in the IPC layer. It might actually be better for big buffers.
I agree with exposing the different LZ4 modes (block/raw vs. frame)
